title: Macfarlane Burnet
summary: Sir Frank Macfarlane Burnet, OM, AK, KBE, FRS, FAA, FRSNZ[1] (3 September 1899 â€“ 31 August 1985[2]), usually known as Macfarlane or Mac Burnet, was an Australian virologist best known for his contributions to immunology. He won a Nobel Prize in 1960 for predicting acquired immune tolerance and was best known for developing the theory of clonal selection.
